alert.note: Alert for Whiteside (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 22 at 2:29PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Whiteside and northeastern Henry Counties through 315 PM CDT... At 227 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Polo to near Tampico. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and heavy rain with rates up to 1 inch per hour. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor flooding is possible. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of Whiteside and northeastern Henry Counties, including the following locations... Yeoward Addition, Whiteside County Airport, Galt, Portland Corners, Prophetstown State Recreation Area, Franklin Corners, Penrose, Round Grove, Hamilton Corners and Malvern. This includes Interstate 88 between mile markers 22 and 44. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
